column4:
1 cup milk of choice
2 tbsp. mocha sauce
1 tbsp. brown sugar
zest from half an orange + zest for topping
4 fl. oz. hot espresso
½ cup heavy whipping cream
1 tbsp. sugar
column5:
Over medium heat, add milk to your saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Add in mocha sauce, brown sugar, and orange zest; whisk briskly to create a layer of foam.
Add hot coffee to cup, pouring directly over white chocolate sauce.
Pour espresso into mug. Add milk mixture; separating and discarding the orange zest.
Top with whipped cream and fresh orange zest, then sit back and enjoy.

column4:
4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate
2 scoops coconut ice cream
2 tbsp semi-sweet chocolate chips
Whipped cream, for topping
Toasted coconut, for garnish
column5:
Open foil pouch. Drop both packets in the pitcher.
Add 4 cups of cold, filtered water to the pitcher and cover.
Steep in the fridge for 24 hours then gently remove the packets.
Store concentrate in the fridge for up to 7 days.

How to make milkshake:
Combine cold brew concentrate, coconut ice cream, and semi-sweet chocolate chips in blender. Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and toasted coconut.

column4:
2 pitcher packs of Starbucks® Cold Brew (1 box contains 2 pitcher packs)
4 cups of cold, filtered water
column5:
Open foil pouch. Drop both packets in the pitcher.
Add 4 cups of cold, filtered water to the pitcher and cover.
Steep in the fridge for 24 hours then gently remove the packets.
Store concentrate in the fridge for up to 7 days.

column4:
1 cup Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate (see directions above)
1/2 cup lemonade (recipe below)
4 oz sparkling water
Lemon slice, for garnish
For Lemonade:
1/4 cup white sugar
2 cups still water
2 oz fresh-squeezed lemon juice
column5:
In a small saucepan, combine sugar and 1/4 cup of the still water. Stir over medium heat until sugar has dissolved into simple syrup, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool completely.
In a pitcher or large jar, add remaining water, the simple syrup, and lemon juice. Stir to combine. Store in an airtight container, refrigerated for up to 7 days.
For Cold Brew Lemonade
Fill a glass with ice. Pour cold brew concentrate and lemonade over ice.
Stir together and top with a splash of sparkling water and a lemon slice.
Serve and enjoy!

column4:
4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate (see directions above)
1 tbsp grapefruit basil simple syrup (recipe below)
4 oz tonic water
Grapefruit slices, for garnish
Basil, for garnish
For grapefruit basil simple syrup
2 oz grapefruit juice
2 oz water
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup fresh basil leaves
Zest of 1 small grapefruit
column5:
For grapefruit basil simple syrup:
Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring until sugar has dissolved.
Strain out the grapefruit zest and basil into an airtight container and keep refrigerated for up to 1 month.
For Grapefruit Basil Cold Brew:
Combine cold brew concentrate, grapefruit basil simple syrup, and tonic water over 2 cups of ice and stir.
Garnish with a slice of grapefruit and basil. Enjoy!

column4:
4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate (see directions above)
2 tbsp maraschino cherry juice
4 oz tonic water
Maraschino cherries, for garnish
column5:
Stir together cold brew concentrate, maraschino cherry juice, and ice.
Top with tonic water and garnish with a maraschino cherry. Enjoy!

column4:
Keurig® brewer
One Starbucks® Salted Caramel Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod
Vanilla ice cream
Ice
column5:
Brew one Starbucks® Salted Caramel Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (4 fl. oz.).
Let cool, and pour into blender.
Add two scoops vanilla ice cream and two cups ice.
Blend until smooth. Pour into a frosted mug.
Add whipped cream, caramel drizzle and a sprinkling of sea salt to finish.

column4:
6oz brewed coffee
3 teaspoons Starbucks® mocha flavored sauce
fleur de sel or flaky sea salt
½ cup milk of choice
whipped cream
caramel drizzle
column5:
Start with adding mocha sauce to your cup.
Add a pinch of fleur de sel.
Rather than espresso, pour in hot coffee and stir to dissolve.
Add milk; cold is great, but hot is better.
Top it off with whipped cream, caramel drizzle and a sprinkle of fleur de sel. Serve and enjoy.

column4:
4 oz Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast K-Cup® Pod, chilled (1 K-Cup® pod brewed at 4 oz)
1 oz triple sec
1 oz agave syrup
3 oz reposado tequila
Orange wedge, for rim of glass
Cinnamon sugar, for rim of glass
Orange peel, for garnish
column5:
Prepare margarita glasses by running orange wedge around the rim of the glass and dipping in cinnamon sugar.
In a cocktail shaker, place triple sec, agave syrup, chilled co­ffee, and tequila. Fill with ice and shake vigorously for 10-15 seconds.
Pour into prepared margarita glasses and garnish with orange zest. Enjoy immediately — hello late night!

column4:
Keurig® brewer
Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod
maraschino cherries
column5:
Add 2 tbsp. cherry juice to your favorite mug.
Brew one Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (8 fl. oz.) directly into mug and stir.
Top with whipped cream and cherry.

column4:
Keurig® brewer
one Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod
Five Spice Blend
column5:
Brew one Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (8 fl. oz.)
Pour directly over 1 tbsp. of Five Spice Blend in your favorite mug.
Stir until well mixed.
Top with whipped cream and an extra sprinkle of Five Spice Blend. Serve and enjoy.

column4:
4 oz brewed Starbucks® Ca­ffè Verona® Ground Coffee (we recommend using the pour-over method)
2 tbsp sweetened condensed milk
Fresh mint sprigs, for garnish
column5:
Pour the sweetened condensed milk into an 8 oz glass, coating the bottom. Top with freshly brewed co­ffee and stir to combine.
Add a scoop of ice and garnish with fresh mint. Serve and enjoy.

column4:
Starbucks® Mocha flavored ground coffee
White chocolate mocha sauce
column5:
Brew 6 fl. oz. of Starbucks® Mocha flavored ground coffee (or K-Cup® pods) double-strength.
Add 2 tbsp. white chocolate mocha sauce to a 12-oz. cup.
Add hot coffee to cup, pouring directly over white chocolate sauce.
Stir vigorously to dissolve. In a separate glass, muddle fresh mint and ice.
Pour coffee mixture over top. Top with whipped cream and a sprig of fresh mint.

column4:
4 oz brewed Starbucks® Pike Place Roast® Ground Coffee, chilled (we recommend using the traditional drip method)
1/2 tbsp simple syrup
Sweet cream syrup (recipe below)

For sweet cream syrup:
1 (14 oz) can sweetened condensed milk
8 oz half & half (or whole milk)
column5:
For sweet cream syrup:
In a medium saucepan, add sweetened condensed milk and half & half (or whole milk). Over low heat, stir frequently for about 5-10 minutes.
Cool completely and keep refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.
For Shakerato:
Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add chilled co­ffee and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously for 20-30 seconds until co­ffee becomes foamy. Strain into a glass. Top with co­ffee foam from shaker.
Add sweet cream syrup to taste.

column4:
2 ½ cups Starbucks® Guatemala Antigua (freshly ground for coffee press)
1 packed tablespoon brown sugar
2 cinnamon sticks
peel of ⅓ of an orange
3 ½ cups cold filtered water
column5:
Add the coffee, sugar, cinnamon sticks, and orange peel to a large 12-cup coffee press. Carefully mix to incorporate the ingredients. Add the cold filtered water. Set the top gently on top of the beaker, without pressing the plunger. Place the mixture in the refrigerator for 18-24 hours.
Press your coffee, pour it into a clean jar, and seal. When you’re ready to serve, pour equal parts concentrated brew and water into a glass and enjoy.
PRO TIP: If you don't have a coffee press, you can use a large jar or bowl and a cheesecloth.

column4:
For Cold Brew Mocha Ice Cubes
Makes enough for 1 standard ice cube tray
1 cup water
¼ cup agave syrup
¼ cup cocoa powder
1 cup Starbucks® Cold Brew (recipe below)

For Cold Brew
Makes 6 cups
2 Starbucks® Cold Brew Coffee Pitcher Packs
7 cups cold, filtered water
column5:
Make Cold Brew
Place 2 Pitcher Packs in a pitcher. Pour 4 cups of filtered water over the Pitcher Packs. Steep the brew in the refrigerator, covered, for 24 hours. Remove and discard the Pitcher Packs, and add in 3 additional cups filtered water.
Make Cold Brew Mocha Ice Cubes
Add the water, agave and cocoa to a heavy-bottom pan, whisking until combined. Bring to a simmer, then remove from heat. Let mixture cool completely. Add 1 cup Starbucks Cold Brew, stir and pour into ice cube trays. When frozen, remove from trays and serve with Starbucks Cold Brew.

column4:
1 packet Starbucks VIA® Instant Classic Iced Coffee
4 cups lemonade
2 tsp. sugar
½ cup cucumber, peeled, seeded and grated
1 cup fresh mint, loosely packed
Ice
For a more coffee-forward beverage, use 2 packets of Starbucks VIA.®
column5:
Dissolve Starbucks VIA® with a tablespoon of hot water in a pitcher.
Add lemonade, sugar, cucumber and mint to pitcher.
Let chill for several hours.
To serve, add ice to glasses and pour beverage over the top.

column4:
4 oz. iced Starbucks® Breakfast Blend
1 ½ ounces flavored vodka (vanilla or caramel)
1 Tbsp. heavy cream
½ cup ice
column5:
Mix together coffee and vodka, stirring as you pour.
Add the remaining ingredients to taste, pour over ice, and enjoy!

column4:
¼ cup sugar, plus extra for garnish
3 cups cranberry juice
1 cup orange juice
1 cup blueberries
1½ cups strawberries, quartered
1 orange, sliced into ¼” wheels, plus zest
2 packets Starbucks VIA® Columbia
1 cup soda water
column5:
Combine sugar, juices and fruit in a pitcher. Stir to dissolve sugar.
Let chill for several hours.
Dissolve Starbucks VIA® with a tablespoon of hot water in a large glass. Add a cup of the juice mixture and stir to fully combine.
Add back into sangria pitcher and stir to combine.
Right before serving, add soda water to sangria pitcher.
Take zest from orange and combine with equal amount of sugar. Dip moistened rims of tall glasses into the mixture.
Evenly divide fruit into glasses. Fill with cold VIA® Sangria and serve your sparkling creation.

column4:
Starbucks Vanilla flavored coffee
2 tbsp. simple syrup
6 fl. oz. sweetened condensed milk
7 fl. oz. low-fat evaporated milk
whipped cream
column5:
Brew 16 fl. oz. Starbucks® Vanilla flavored coffee.
Mix coffee with 2 tbsp. simple syrup. Pour mixture into ice cube tray and freeze.
In a blender, combine coffee ice cubes, 6 fl. oz. sweetened condensed milk and 7 fl. oz. low-fat evaporated milk.
Blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into individual cups and top with whipped cream.

column4:
1 packet Starbucks VIA® Instant Caramel Latte
1 cup milk
3 tbsp. butterscotch baking chips
1 tsp. sugar
column5:
Place VIA®, butterscotch and sugar in a mug.
Heat milk and pour into mug.
Stir together until chips are melted.
Sip and savor or pour into a thermos to enjoy on-the-go.

column4:
3 ½ oz Starbucks® Pike Place Roast coffee (brewed at double strength)
1 oz Irish whiskey
1 ½ oz Irish cream liqueur
1 mint sprig
Ice
column5:
Pour double-strength coffee, whiskey, and Irish cream liqueur over ice and stir.
Add mint sprig for garnish. Enjoy!

column4:
6 oz Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee
1 small banana
1/2 cup chocolate almond milk
2 tablespoon chia seeds
1 tablespoon of honey
1 tablespoon peanut butter
Optional: 1 cup ice cubes
column5:
Add 6 oz Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee, 1 small banana, 1/2 cup chocolate almond milk, 2 tablespoon chia seeds, 1 tablespoon honey and 1 tablespoon peanut butter to the blender.
Blend until smooth.
Add 1 cup ice cubes to make smoothie thicker of you would like.
Blend again.

column4:
1 cup double-strength coffee* (try Starbucks® Kenya brewed in a Coffee Press)
½ cup lemonade (fresh-squeezed or readymade)
Splash of sparkling water

For Homemade Lemonade (Makes about 3 cups)
¼ cup white sugar
2 cups water
¼ cup fresh-squeezed lemon juice
column5:
Make Homemade Lemonade:
In a small saucepan, combine sugar and ¼ cup of the water. Stir over medium heat until sugar has dissolved into simple syrup, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool completely.
In a pitcher or large jar, add remaining water, the simple syrup and lemon juice. Stir to combine. Store in an airtight container, refrigerated, for up to 3–4 weeks.
Make Iced Coffee Lemonade:
Fill a glass with ice. Pour double-strength coffee and lemonade over the ice. Stir together, then top with a splash of sparkling water and lemon slice. Serve and enjoy.
*Note: Because the ice and lemonade will dilute the coffee, you’ll want to double brew it. If you’re using a coffee press, add four tablespoons of coffee to every six ounces of water.

column4:
1 cup powdered sugar
1-2 Tbsp. (warm) strong brewed coffee
column5: Whisk together powdered sugar and coffee in a small bowl until smooth and reaches the desired thickness. Drizzle over your favorite croissants and pastries.
